<JD_START>
Job Title: Power-Business Development Manager

Location: Minnesota, United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Business Development, Sales

Description:
About Mortenson

As a Top 25 builder, developer, and EPC, our expertise spans markets like sports, renewable energy, data centers, healthcare, and more. We are builders at heart, working to ensure the built environment has a lasting positive impact. 

Let’s Redefine Possible® 

Summary

Do you love building relationships and delivering excellent customer service?

Mortenson is currently seeking an experienced Business Development Manager to join our Power Delivery Services Group and partner with business unit market leaders in developing and supporting positioning strategies with existing and potential customers to win project work. All of your work should be performed with initiative, productivity, and a positive attitude. Excellent written and verbal interpersonal skills are vital as you will be interacting with staff at all levels in an ever-changing environment. You should also display the ability to remain flexible, inventive, dedicated, and efficient with a significant amount of integrity and confidentiality.

Responsibilities

Lead the positioning activities of the business development team

Participate in strategic business planning; developing strategic positioning plan for company and project pursuits to win workDevelop and produce internal and external communications, marketing/branding/advertising materials and presentationsCoordinate prequalification efforts with targeted customers and partnersInitiate customer feedback on proposals and presentationsFunction as the liaison between business development, pre-construction, and marketingProvide insight into market sectors; perform market trends analysis

Establish and cultivate strategic business partnerships and customer relationships

Develop and maintain relationships with current and potential partners including, but not limited to; targeted customers, design professionals, partner companies, community leaders, utilities, equipment manufacturers, and engineering firmsIdentify new market sector opportunities and potential future customers and convert them to contacts for market sector leadersFamiliarize yourself with customer’s project estimates to facilitate discussion with customerComplete Request for Proposals with 100% accuracy and compliance with the owner’s specifications

Play an integral role with the development team 

Take work direction, utilize training, and complete performance reviewsUse appropriate level of forethought and planning in decision- making to assure project success

Qualifications

Proven customer relationship building skills, with developed local/regional/national business knowledge and relationshipsProven knowledge and execution of successful marketing strategiesDemonstrated knowledge of North American power delivery market and the participants, specifically utilities, independent transmission providers (ITPs), independent power producers (IPPs), and original equipment manufacturers (OEMs)Knowledge of construction law and generally accepted business practicesProficient in engineering, procurement, and construction (EPC) delivery methods, specifically substation and transmission line design, equipment, and constructionAbility to visit projects sites and/or review RFP requirements independently and communicate requirements, risks, and strategy to successfully win and execute the workDetail orientation sufficient for data entry, reporting, financial projections for sales and selections, and market analysisMicrosoft Office, project and pertinent CRM web application skills at an advanced levelProven positive and professional attitude, and strong customer service skillsAbility to interpret and communicate Mortenson policiesMinimum five years prior industry-related power generation and/or power delivery experienceCurrent driver’s licenseTravel of up to 30% of time may be necessary to fulfill the objectives of the position.

Education

Bachelor’s degree in Business, Construction Management, Marketing, Engineering or a related field

Mortenson is an EOE/Affirmative Action/M/F/Veteran/Disabled employer.

Visa sponsorship is not offered for this position.

 No Agency emails, calls or solicitations accepted ** 10821

Experience Level (if available): None
<JD_END>
